question: 丁度
sourceMnemonic: Okay, we're going to cheat a little bit to remember the meaning of this word. Let's say you take the temperature of the <kanji>street</kanji>. It is exactly one hundred <kanji>degree</kanji>s. That's <vocabulary>exactly</vocabulary> what it is. <vocabulary>Just</vocabulary> 100 degrees, not one degree more or less. You put your eggs on the street and watch them cook.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
